scenario_text.value:
Hello, there, Takuma. The ghost doesn’t seem
to be anywhere around here.

Professor, are you not afraid of ghosts
because you’re an adult?

What? Oh no, I’m sure if one suddenly
appeared in front of me, I’d be quite scared.

But I had a feeling the ghost you’d seen was
the companion of the Sovereign Monster.
Oh, you did, huh? I should’ve known.

Yet his being here, outside the shrine, must
have some significance.

I was thinking the same thing. What do you
think he’s trying to do?

That’s a good question. Why don’t you think
it through a little more yourself?
Uh, okay.

(Why would he be doing this? It must have
something to do with the Sovereign Monsters.)

(I can think of a few different things, but
it depends on if he’s a friend or a foe.)
(Why would he reveal himself to us?)
To help us.
To lure us.
To learn about us.
To help us.
To...try to help us somehow?

Interesting. So you believe the last
Sovereign Monster is committed to helping us?
Well, I hope he is.

Heheh, perhaps that’s too optimistic. Or to
put it a bit less charitably, naive.
Yeah, I know...

Were this the first of them, that might make
sense, but we’ve been tested three times now.
To lure us.
Maybe...to lure us into their territory?

You believe they want us at a disadvantage
for the trial so they’re luring us somewhere?

Every other one has tested us. I find it hard
to believe this one wouldn’t.

That...sounds like a reasonable supposition
to me, though I’m not sure it’s quite right.

The trials have all been difficult, but
they’ve also been fair tests of our ability.

Doesn’t it seem strange that this one alone
would seek to put us at a disadvantage?

I guess...but I don’t think we can rule it
out.

Yes. This is the last of the trials, and it
may well be the hardest. It is possible.

Which is why all I can say is that it doesn’t
seem quite right to me.
To learn about us.

Could it be to learn about us? See who’s side
we’re on, and if we’re worthy of the trial?

Yes, that’s what I believe as well. Only,
it’s strange...

The other Sovereign Monsters tested us
themselves. This one sent its companion.

And now that I think of it, none of the
others refused us access to the trial.

Yes, that’s true. In which case, perhaps this
ghost isn’t here to gather information.

Yet while we may posit various explanations,
I don’t believe we can say for sure.
(So the professor doesn’t know either...)
Hahaha, did I disappoint you?

I’m afraid such speculation can only serve as
a thought experiment. A mental exercise.

To learn more, we must first find some way to
communicate.
Yeah, I know...

(The problem is we don’t even know where to
start.)

I must say, though, this paranormal activity
is fascinating. How do these things move?
